result.execSummary:
The defendant Jackie C Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: As to count 1 amended and Count 2: Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and Victim surcharges by 08/01/16.  Failure to pay is civil judgment.
As to Count 1 amended  and Count 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 98 days at HOC with 98 days credit. This is a time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jackie C Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Jackie Brown, Letter Seeking Payment Plan

PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1 amended and Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 98 days at the House of Corrections with 98 days credit. This is a time served disposition.

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 08/01/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA any victim surcharges).


Filed:    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

As to Count 1 amended and Count 2: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Jackie C Brown in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Jackie C Brown in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Entry into Locked Building, Dwelling or Room-PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.15(1), 939.51(3)(a), and 939.05 a Class A Misdemeanor.
Court ordered Count 2 Theft (value not exceeding $2,500)-PTAC added, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), and 939.05 a Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Jackie C Brown not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Jackie C Brown not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jackie C Brown in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Jackie C Brown in custody.  Irene Parthum for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CO-DEF:  LARRY JOHNSON AND KIM PATTERSON.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jackie C Brown in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
